compute¶

Compute module.

Compute module provide functions to compute service of Fujitsu K5 cloud REST API
k5lib.compute.add_server_interface(project_token, region, project_id, server_id, net_id, ip_address=None)¶

Add interface into server.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID of the server
  • net_id – ID of the network interface is connected
  • ip_address – (Optional) fixed ip address for interface
Returns:

JSON if succesful. otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.compute.create_keypair(project_token, project_id, region, az, keypair_name)¶

Create a keypair to logging in vm.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • project_id – K5 project ID.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • az – K5 availability zone name.
  • keypair_name – Name of keypair.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.compute.create_server(project_token, region, az, project_id, server_name, key_name, sg_name, flavor_id, image_id, vol_size, network_id=None, ip=None, port_id=None, dedicated=False)¶

Create server from image.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – A K5 region
  • az – Availability zone withing region
  • project_id – ID of the project
  • server_name – Name of the server
  • key_name – Name of Keypair
  • sg_name – Name of the security group
  • flavor_id – ID of the flavor to be used
  • image_id – ID of the image.
  • vol_size – Size of the volume.
  • network_id – ID of the network. (optional).
  • ip – Fixed IP address from network. (optional)
  • port_id – ID of the port. (optional)
  • dedicated – Dedicated host. (boolean). (optional). If set to True VM will be provisioned into dedicated host.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from request library.

Note

Create port before hand and pass port UUID on port_id parameter. This way you can create a server with floating IP address. If port ID is defined Network ID and ip parameters are rejected.

Note

You need to provide both network_id and ip parameters if you want to use fixed IP on your server.

k5lib.compute.create_server_from_volume(project_token, region, az, project_id, server_name, key_name, sg_name, flavor_id, volume_id, vol_size, network_id, dedicated=False)¶

Create dedicated server from volume. One network card. IP from DHCP

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – A K5 region
  • az – Availability zone withing region
  • project_id – ID of the project
  • server_name – Name of the server
  • key_name – Key name
  • sg_name – Name of the security group
  • flavor_id – ID of the flavor to be used
  • image_id – ID of the image
  • vol_size – Size of the volume example “50”
  • network_id – ID of the network.
  • dedicated – (boolean). If set to True vm will be provisioned into dedicated host.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.compute.create_server_with_ip(project_token, region, az, project_id, server_name, key_name, sg_name, flavor_id, image_id, vol_size, network_id, ip, dedicated=False)¶

Create dedicated server from image. One network card, fixed IP address.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – A K5 region
  • az – Availability zone withing region
  • project_id – ID of the project
  • server_name – Name of the server
  • key_name – Key name
  • sg_name – Name of the security group
  • flavor_id – ID of the flavor to be used
  • image_id – ID of the image
  • vol_size – Size of the volume example “50”
  • network_id – ID of the network.
  • ip – IP address of the server.
  • dedicated – (boolean). If set to True vm will be provisioned into dedicated host.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.compute.delete_server(project_token, region, project_id, server_id)¶

Delete Server

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – Valid K5 region
  • project_id – Valid K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID osf the server
Returns:

http 204 if succesfull otherwise http error code.
k5lib.compute.detach_server_interface(project_token, region, project_id, server_id, port_id)¶

Detach interface from server.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID of the server
  • port_id – ID of port (interface) we are deleting.
Returns:

http 202 response if succesful. Otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.compute.get_flavor_id(project_token, region, project_id, flavor_name)¶

Get ID for flavor name

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID.
  • flavor_name – Name of the flavor.
Returns:

ID of flavor if succesful, otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.compute.get_server_id(project_token, region, project_id, server_name)¶

Get ID of the server. Returns first server found that match server_name parameter.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_name – Name of the server
Returns:

ID of the server if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.

  • project_id – K5 project ID

  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID of the server
  • port_id – ID of port (interface) we are intrested.
Returns:

Get name of the server. Returns first server found that match server_id parameter.

Parameters:

  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID of the server
Returns:

Name of the server if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.compute.get_server_password(project_token, region, project_id, server_id)¶

Get server password hash. You need to decrypt hash with private key to get password.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • server_id – ID of the server
Returns:

Password hash as a binary object if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token.
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • region – K5 region name
  • server_id – server ID
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.

  • region – K5 region name.
  • project_id – a Valid project id
Returns:

JSON that contains keypairs if successful. Otherwise error from requests library.
